reviews.review_msg: Bad attitude. You wont get much help from him. If your TA doesn't have office hour either, you are screwed.

The perfect formula for an A+ in this class is this: go to class + and understand HW + memorize all proofs (~10).  Nothing out of the ordinary appears in his tests.  But you'll need a good TA otherwise no one's gonna help you.

This guy kicks A$$! He one of the best profs I have. Awesome accent, and good lectures. I was never bored in his class. Tests are hard, but thats good because everybody fails and makes your makes look good.
Easy course, but this guy made it so boring!  His accent was sometimes difficult to understand.

i agree that the assignments are easy but his mid-term and final are hard and quite different from his notes, assignment. u have to fully understand what he is talking about in lecture. don't take his course unless u are a clever and hard working student.
easy assignment and lectures but hard exams.He used to be a nice guy but not now

Dr. Chauve was trying to cover as much material as possible and sometimes, it was hard to understand the def w/out instant examples. The stuff can be a bit challenging. Definitely go to his office hours. He would answer your questions and help with your hw. Be prepared for some French accent but it's still understandable. Generally, a nice prof!!

This class teaches his area of expertise so he is knowledgeable. The material is a good blend of classical results and some useful modern results. Homework and exams felt hard at first but became easier with experience. He speaks with a heavy French accent and puts out more typos in written material than any SFU prof I know. Otherwise, solid prof.

This professor is very disorganized. They don't upload materials properly or on time. They often come late to class and don't teach the material clearly. The questions they give on tests are much harder than what they teach in class, and their notes are very hard to understand. Overall, the class is very confusing, and I have struggled a lot.

Nice guy, but didn't return a single grade back for 2 + 1/4 months. Lecture pace is an absolute mess (1-4 for midterm 1, 5-17 for midterm 2), which heavily impacted midterm studying and assignments. HW 1,2 was for the first midterm, and only had HW 3 for the second midterm that went up to lecture 7 ---> 10 lectures no practice. Please avoid him.

Probably the worst professor I ever seen at SFU. Always late, class ends minimum 15 minutes after the time it should be.     Notes, or solution he posting has at least 5 typo or error each, and has not released any grades until the last lecture. So unorganized.. But he is a nice person, but as a professor.. no deal.
Really enjoys graph theory.  Funny and engaging.
